intro: Senecio pseudochina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio pseudochina is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
